segments.pli: “Chahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato rañño bhadro assājānīyo rājāraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅgantveva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a fine royal thoroughbred with six factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is considered a factor of kingship.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, rañño bhadro assājānīyo khamo hoti rūpānaṃ, khamo saddānaṃ, khamo gandhānaṃ, khamo rasānaṃ, khamo phoṭṭhabbānaṃ, balasampanno ca hoti.
segments.en: It’s when a fine royal thoroughbred can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches. And it’s strong.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi aṅgehi samannāgato rañño bhadro assājānīyo rājāraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅgantveva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.
segments.en: A fine royal thoroughbred with these six factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is considered a factor of kingship.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu āhuneyyo … pe … anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.
segments.en: In the same way, a mendicant with six factors is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khamo hoti rūpānaṃ … pe … khamo dhammānaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu āhuneyyo hoti … pe … anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassā”ti.
segments.en: A mendicant with these six factors is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, a fine royal thoroughbred with six factors is…

suttaplex.blurb: A steed is worthy of the king for six reasons, and a mendicant is worthy for six similar reasons.
